long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
Upon installation, the extension automatically blocks notifications from all sites.

When user visits a site that uses service workers or requests notification permissions, a custom notification will appear, giving user the option to allow or block notifications.
Popular sites are automatically whitelisted to ensure user receives important notifications without manual intervention.
Using the extensionâ€™s interface to add or remove sites from  users whitelist.

Automatically blocking or allowing push notifications based on users preferences. The extension detects when a site attempts to request notification permissions or uses service workers to send notifications, giving user the power to decide.

Popular websites such as Google, Facebook, and Bing are automatically allowed to send notifications, ensuring user can stay connected with the sites that matter most.

Easy manage of notification settings with an intuitive interface. Add or remove sites from whitelist with just a few clicks.

When a site attempts to send push notifications, a custom notification will appear, asking user to allow or block notifications. This ensures that user is always in control of what notifications he receives.

Ability to reduce unwanted interruptions and maintain focus by blocking notifications from distracting websites.

Why Install?

User can decide which sites can send him notifications and block those he finds unnecessary or intrusive. Also by blocking notifications from certain sites, user can maintain better focus on his tasks. User can easily update his preferences and manage his notification settings from a single, convenient interface. User can be ensured, that he will never miss important notifications from critical sites by whitelisting them.
